topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example: Add a DEA Node to an Existing Cluster

body.p: This example demonstrates how to add a DEA node to a cluster that already exists.

p.note: This sample creates five DEAs. Ensure you have enough disk space to do so.

ul.li: The host for the examples needs to be able to reach your HPE Helion OpenStack environment.
Download the version of the cluster management (cf-mgmt) tool appropriate for your operating system.

ol.li: Download the latest bootstrap.yml file and save it in a location where the cf-mgmt tool can access it.

Open and configure the bootstrap_dea.yml file to match your environment. Ensure the values for image names, image sizes and availability zones ("az") are valid for your current configuration. Here is an example:file version: 1.2 constructor-image-name: HPE Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HPE Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> dea-count: 5 dea-flavor: standard.medium az: <My Availability Zone> The default values create Lucid64 DEAs. To add Windows DEAs instead, provide a valid Windows image name and specify the stack parameter: --stack "win2012r2"

Run the following command, inserting the correct values as appropriate.
This example will work for the Windows operating system.cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <OpenStack authentication URL> ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ add-role dea ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --load bootstrap_dea.yml
This example will work on Mac OSX or Linux: source <path to openstackrc file> cf-mgmt.exe \ add-role dea \ --keypair-name <keypair name> \ --load bootstrap_dea.yml
